title: Seminar flags federalism concerns over VBSA Bill
content: The event, organised by the Kerala State Higher Education Council, called for rigorous scrutiny of the proposed legislation

title: Mysuru targets top-3 rank in SSLC, PU results this year
content: Steps initiated by the deputy director of Pre-University Education to enhance PUC performances were also reviewed at the meeting

title: Rahul Gandhi calls BCCI VP Rajiv Shukla, requests cricket academy in Raebareli
content: Rahul Gandhi arrived in Raebareli, his parliamentary constituency, on a two-day visit on January 19, a party official said

title: Parents, citizens stage protest against closure of govt. schools
content: Government Orders criticised for proposing to convert schools in 5,900 gram panchayats in the State into Karnataka Public Schools

title: Changes in Kerala school arts fest only after discussions with stakeholders: Director of General Education
content: Discussions on possible change in the festival’s manual could start in the new academic year, he adds

title: Centre sanctions 50-bed AYUSH hospital for Tenali, says A.P. Minister
content: Nadendla Manohar says the sanction of an AYUSH hospital for Tenali is a matter of pride and keeping future requirements in mind, the possibility of establishing a nursing college on the campus is also being explored

title: Andhra Pradesh attracted 25% of FDI in India, Naidu says in Davos
content: UAE agrees to support collaboration between A.P.’s food processing sector and Dubai Food Cluster and assures facilitation of investments from 40 Emirati companies, says CMO

title: ‘Chief of Flight Safety’ to ensure safety of airline operations: DGCA
content: To prevent accidents or incidents, DGCA has asked the operators to set up a dedicated ‘Flight Safety Department’ with adequate number of competent personnel

title: Clamour for making J.B. Koshy Commission report public grows louder in Kerala’s Catholic belt
content: Church leaders question the government’s claims of implementing its recommendations, call it an attempt at consolidating Christian votes ahead of the polls. They urge the government to disclose the report’s contents.

title: State govt. can go ahead with recruitments without applying increase in quota limit: Karnataka High Court
content: Bench in its November 19 interim order had restrained the State government from implementing the increase in reservations in terms of the 2022 Act

title: ‘Where is the election’, Congress asks, taking a swipe at the poll process for new BJP chief
content: ‘You announce the president first and then say there will be an election, and then there is no election,’ the Congress’s media and publicity department chairperson Pawan Khera says

title: Apprenticeship and Employment Fair in Hubballi tomorrow
content: KLE Technological University, in collaboration with the Union Ministry of Education, the State Department of Technical Education, is organising it

title: Supreme Court decides to examine query by T.N., Kerala, if ED is a ‘juristic person’
content: Both States want to know if the Central agency, like a ‘natural person’, can approach High Court to enforce rights under Article 226

title: Pandemic preparedness plans being formulated across all local self-governments, says Governor in policy address
content: Tackling lifestyle diseases, emergency and trauma care and elderly care will be the main public health priorities for the State in the next few years, Mr. Arlekar says

title: Four-day iLYF Veerashaiva Lingayat Global Conclave starting Jan. 29
content: It is aimed at bringing entrepreneurs, industry leaders, policy-makers, start-ups, MSMEs and global business stakeholders under one roof

title: Any higher education regulator must oversee Article 15(5) implementation, says Congress
content: Referring to the Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill, 2025, which seeks to establish a single regulator for higher education and was introduced in the Lok Sabha on December 15, 2025, Jairam Ramesh said such a body must have a clear mandate to ensure the implementation of Article 15(5).

title: Andhra Pradesh to launch 50% Green Cover Project from Ugadi
content: As an intermediate goal, the government aims to increase green cover to 37 per cent by 2030, says Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan

title: Tamil Nadu govt. urges Centre to withdraw VB-G RAM-G and enhance funds for MGNREGS
content: It says the discontinuation of MGNREGS not only hinders development in rural areas but also aggravates the financial strain on the State. Owing to VB-G RAM-G, the financial burden on Tamil Nadu will further increase by approximately ₹5,000 crore a year, according to the Governor’s address to the Assembly

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Works on BESS plant to start by December, says Nandyal Collector
content: The plant will be set up by the Solar Energy Corporation of India in 38.4-acre land in Nandipadu village of Kolimigundla mandal in the district

title: 18,600 waterbirds spotted during survey in Vembanad region
content: Organised by Periyar West Division of Kerala Forest and Wildlife department in association with Kottayam Nature Society

title: Governor’s policy address: legislative procedures for ‘Nativity Card’ in final stages
content: Digital resurvey project aimed at comprehensive digitisation of land records nears completion, says Governor

title: DKS waiting patiently, power does not come easily to anyone: D.K. Suresh
content: Senior leader Rahul Gandhi had assured that an appropriate decision would be taken at the right time, said the brother of Deputy Chief Minister

title: ‘Illegal immigrants’, ‘urban Naxals’ threat to national security: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister accused some political parties of shielding illegal immigrants in the interest of votebank politics and giving them cover

title: TVK’s election manifesto will focus on social justice, uplifting marginalised sections: Arunraaj
content: Party panel would tour zone-wise to elicit the views of various sections, including trade unions, associations and other organisations, he says

title: The rise of bhajan clubbing: How young India is reimagining spirituality
content: All about bhajan clubbing, a growing trend where youngsters blend devotional music with club-style energy

title: ‘Jana Nayagan’ censor row: Madras High Court reserves orders on CBFC’s writ appeal
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan defer their verdict after hearing Additional Solicitor General AR.L. Sundaresan and senior counsel Satish Parasaran

title: Skoda Auto India plans 10 product introductions in 2026
content: Strong sales growth in 2025, expansion in market reach and upgrades to key models underpin the company’s roadmap

title: Bengaluru cyber crime police recover ₹2.16 crore in major email spoofing fraud case
content: The accused spoofed official email IDs linked to Dr. Reddy’s Laboratories, a Hyderabad-based pharmaceutical company, and used the forged email credentials to deceive company representatives.

title: U.S. senator concludes visit to India to persuade leaders to include ‘favourable’ pulse provisions in future FTA
content: During his visit, Mr. Daines met Minister of External Affairs S. Jaishankar, Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal, members of parliament, and U.S. and Indian business leaders.

title: Over 180 tonnes of smuggled diesel seized from cargo barge off Mumbai coast; two held
content: One water tank on the barge was found not to be part of the approved design by the Indian Register of Shipping (IRS)

title: Karnataka Women’s Commission seeks action against senior IPS officer Ramachandra Rao
content: The commission has called for a transparent inquiry, suspension from service and strict action under a zero-tolerance policy.

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly session to conclude on January 24
content: The House would debate on the motion of thanks to the Governor’s address to the House on January 22 and 23. The reply to the debate is scheduled on January 24

title: Trinamool Congress says West Bengal will resist moves that make voting ‘burdensome’
content: SIR is ‘Software Intensive Rigging’, alleges Trinamool Congress, as the party seeks more transparency in the process

title: Open-air workshop to take up acclaimed poems on Kolkata for translation
content: Called Maidane Anubade Mahanagar (The City in Translation at the Maidan), this workshop-cum–translators’ meet will be held on January 25

title: KMC focuses on collecting property tax arrears
content: According to KMC officials, there are 1,24,049 property tax assessees in the city, with a total demand of ₹128.11 crore, including arrears of ₹45.33 crore and demand for current year of ₹82.77 crore

title: DMK to bat for Constitutional amendment to do away with Governor’s customary address: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin
content: Governor’s action has proved The Hindu’s editorial to be right, wrote Chief Minister in a social media post

title: Noida techie death: Developer accused of negligence arrested; SIT begins probe, report due in five days
content: The police have filed an FIR against two real estate developers — MZ Wiztown Planners and Lotus Greens — on a complaint by the victim's father

title: Clashes erupt, RAF deployed, internet services suspended in Assam’s Kokrajhar, Chirang
content: Chief Himanta Biswa Sarma said that arrangements are in place to deploy the army while the Rapid Action Force (RAF) is already on the ground following clashes and mob violence in Kokrajhar district

title: SC to examine Karnataka HC’s decision to quash KCOCA against BJP MLA in murder case
content: KCOCA can be invoked provided the offence has a minimum punishment of three years, a condition that the HC had cited while giving relief to the BJP leader; to this the SC asked, “what would happen to Section 307 of the IPC” which does not specify a minimum punishment against murder

title: Kerala Governor announces Pattissery dam in Idukki to be commissioned by February 15
content: Pattissery dam project involves water entitled to Kerala under Cauvery Inter-State River Water Dispute. The Banasura Sagar main canal is expected to be ready by May and Karappuzha project, by December

title: Telangana Govt yet to finalise dates for crediting Rythu Bandhu amounts into farmers’ accounts
content: Non completion of survey of agricultural lands is said to be the reason behind the delay in crediting the farmers investment support

title: BJP councillor R. Sreelekha calls for relocating dry waste collection facility in front of her office in Kerala capital
content: The facility, with bins for segregated collection of waste, has been popular with residents ever since it was opened eight years ago. Sreelekha says demand raised to ease pedestrian issues

title: APSRTC records all-time high revenue of ₹27.68 crore on January 19, 2026
content: As many as 5.06 million passengers travelled by APSRTC buses across the State in the post Sankranti travel

title: Carving of mythological Gandabherunda found at Vinukonda Narasimhaswamy temple
content: This temple must have been one of the famous Vaishnava temples at that time. Because, only great temples generally have this kind of Gandabherunda carvings, ASI Director said

title: Satheesan slams Kerala Governor’s policy address as filled with ‘half-truths and fake claims’ of LDF govt
content: Opposition Leader says LDF government’s ‘failures can be read in between the lines’ of the policy document

title: Hoosiers cap perfect season, win 1st national title
content: Indiana completed an undefeated season and won its first national title, beating Miami 27-21 in College Football Playoff final Monday night.

title: Miami's Beck: Game-sealing INT, loss 'really hurts'
content: Quarterback Carson Beck shouldered the blame after a late miscommunication resulted in an interception and the end of Miami's magical season.

title: Sources: Titans finalizing deal to make Saleh coach
content: Robert Saleh is set to become the next coach of the Titans, with sources telling ESPN's Adam Schefter on Monday night that the sides are finalizing a deal.

title: Dolphins hire Packers' Hafley as new head coach
content: The Miami Dolphins hired Green Bay Packers defensive coordinator Jeff Hafley as their next head coach, the club announced on Monday night.

title: Self hospitalized out of caution, not with Kansas
content: Kansas men's basketball coach Bill Self was hospitalized Monday out of caution and did not travel with the team to Colorado, the school announced.

title: Knicks showered with boos in 'embarrassing' loss
content: The Knicks have gone from NBA Cup champions to not even being able to rule out the play-in tournament thanks to a January freefall that saw them lose for the ninth time in 11 games with their 114-97 defeat to the Mavericks.

title: Goalies drop gloves in Sharks' rout of Panthers
content: A goalie fight broke out with 14 minutes left in a game Monday night between the Panthers and Sharks that had become increasingly chippy with post-whistle pushing and shoving.

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25: Sizing up the top contenders for next season
content: Who will raise the national championship trophy this time next year? We break down the teams to watch.

title: Was Sean McDermott really Buffalo's problem? There's plenty of blame to go around for its playoff woes
content: With postseason losses piling up, the Bills fired coach Sean McDermott. But will it change anything? And where did things go wrong?

title: Thunder's slide weakening repeat bid? Clippers in the play-in? Debating four midseason trends
content: ESPN analysts Zach Kram and Kevin Pelton break down the league's biggest storylines from leading challengers to surprise contenders.

title: NBA All-Star rosters: Starters, snubs and biggest questions
content: Who was the biggest surprise or snub? Which superstar duo are we most excited to see? Experts break it down.

title: Indiana fans erase forgettable history with unforgettable title
content: Indiana had the most losses, a long Big Ten title drought, no Heismans and no national titles. No more.

title: Men's Bracketology: Don't write off Houston just yet
content: The Cougars remain national title contenders despite falling off the radar at the turn of the calendar year.

title: Women's Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: USMNT World Cup Big Board 4.0: Pochettino's roster coming into focus
content: We're less than five months away from the USMNT's World Cup opener, and with the clock ticking down, Mauricio Pochettino's squad is coming into focus.

title: Are Patriots QB Drake Maye's turnovers an issue against the Broncos?
content: The Broncos' defense is the best in the league at getting to the quarterback. How will the Patriots respond?

title: The Caleb throw, a controversial call and plenty of mistakes: Barnwell sizes up 11 divisional round plays
content: Let's sort out Caleb Williams' wild fourth-quarter TD throw, the Broncos' controversial INT, a big Seattle kickoff return TD, a C.J. Stroud pick-six and more.

title: 'Everyone has someone to cheer for': Inside Fernando Mendoza's Miami homecoming
content: Indiana's quarterback has deep roots in South Florida, creating some split loyalties for the title game.

title: The Knicks, Nets and a crosstown friendship nearly two decades in the making
content: In 2009, Mike Brown met Jordi Fernandez and got him an internship with the Cavaliers. Seventeen years later, their relationship runs far deeper just than New York City basketball rivals.

title: 'Obviously, we would have a great team': What Russian NHLers are saying about missing the Olympics
content: Russia is suspended from international competition due to the war in Ukraine, sidelining many who'd otherwise be playing.

title: Does bringing in a 'caretaker manager' work? Will Man United and Real Madrid improve?
content: Both Man United and Real Madrid abruptly fired their coaches without permanent replacements lined up, so "caretaker managers" will see out the season.

title: Men's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Arizona solidifies spot, Kansas returns
content: The latest top-25 poll is out, featuring all three unbeaten teams. What's next for all 25 ranked teams?

title: Let's overreact to divisional round games: Pause Stroud's extension talks? Concern about Stafford?
content: Hold off on any new Stroud deals? Matthew Stafford is in a funk? No Super Bowl yet again for Buffalo? Let's make sense of every divisional round game.

title: Sizing up the AL Central: What each team still needs to do before spring training
content: There haven't been a lot of headline deals in this division so far, but there's still work left this winter.

title: Will Colts, Daniel Jones run it back in 2026?
content: There's mutual interest, but there's also the matter of the QB's recovery from a December torn Achilles.

title: 'Small details make the difference': How Jannik Sinner has changed his game since the US Open
content: At the 2025 US Open, Sinner was soundly beaten by Alcaraz. Since then, the two-time Australian Open champ has made adjustments.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Tottenham's Van de Ven
content: Liverpool and Real Madrid are keeping tabs on Tottenham's Micky van de Ven. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Transfer window weekly: Güler to Arsenal? Chelsea squad changes?
content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Natalia Silva, Max Holloway can create UFC chaos immediately in 2026
content: Natalia Silva, Amanda Nunes, Max Holloway and more fighters who can derail UFC championship predictions in 2026.

title: At Davos, Satya Nadella Recalls Indian Farmers' AI Adoption As Early As 2023
content: Pointing to how Artificial Intelligence (AI) is being used across the world, beyond advanced countries, Microsoft Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Satya Nadella recalled an Indian farmer who adopted AI to address problems.

title: AIMIM Chief Rules Out BJP Alliance After Maharashtra Civic Poll Gains
content: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday ruled out any possibility of aligning with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) following his party's strong performance in the Maharashtra municipal elections.

title: How AI Helped Delhi Police Identify RWA President's Killers
content: The Delhi Police has solved the daylight murder of a woman in Shalimar Bagh by using artificial intelligence tools to enhance blurred CCTV footage, leading to the identification and arrest of three men from Bihar, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Delhi Teen Stabs Tuition Teacher For Sexually Assaulting 14-Year-Old Friend
content: An 18-year-old youth has been arrested for allegedly stabbing a tutor who had been sexually assaulting his 14-year-old friend for the past six months, police said on Tuesday.

title: Davos Live Updates: Trump Heads To Davos With "Largest" US Delegation Yet
content: US President Donald Trump's third visit to Davos as president comes as US allies worry about his ambition to take over Greenland.

title: NDTV Impact: High Court Action Over Madhya Pradesh Tiger Deaths, SIT Formed
content: Madhya Pradesh's image as the world-famous "Tiger State" has come under sharp judicial and administrative scrutiny following an NDTV report that exposed alarming tiger mortality figures in 2025.

title: Noida Techie's Car Pulled Out 3 Days After It Fell Into Pit, May Offer Vital Clues
content: The Grand Vitara driven by 27-year-old software engineer Yuvraj Mehta, which veered off the road and landed in a water-filled construction pit amid dense fog in the early hours of Saturday, has finally been recovered.

title: "What's Happening In Greenland, Gaza, Venezuela Beyond Parody": William Dalrymple
content: William Dalrymple, host of the globally acclaimed podcast "Empire: World History" - which currently boasts over a million monthly downloads - is a man who views the chaos of the present through the long, often bloody lens of the past.

title: 3 Killed, 7 Injured After Car Rams Parked Container In Rajasthan
content: A tragic road accident in Jaipur claimed the lives of a mother, her son, and daughter-in-law after their speeding car rammed into a parked container truck.

title: After Noida Techie's Death, Delhi To Map High-Risk Zones On Google Maps
content: Following the fatal Noida incident, a Delhi Police chief has directed district-level officers to work with government agencies to identify and secure accident-prone and high-risk locations across the national capital.

title: All About Chagos Islands As Trump Calls UK's Sovereignty Deal 'Stupidity'
content: US President Donald Trump has turned his fire on a deal between Britain and Mauritius to settle the future of the Chagos Islands, the contested Indian Ocean archipelago that is home to a strategic US military base.

title: "Hard To Imagine": Zelensky Hesitant To Work With Putin On Gaza Peace Board
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that US President Donald Trump had invited him to join the "Board of Peace" that was formed to implement the US-brokered peace plan between Israel and Hamas.

title: Anti-Pollution Curbs Under GRAP 4 Revoked In Delhi As Air Quality Improves
content: The Centre's pollution watchdog on Tuesday revoked curbs under Stage-4 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) in Delhi-NCR as the capital's air quality improved.

title: Europe Vows "Unflinching" Response To Trump, Calls Tariffs A "Mistake"
content: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen vowed an "unflinching" response to US President Donald Trump's threats regarding Greenland.

title: 7 Indian CEOs Invited To Trump's Reception At World Economic Forum In Davos
content: The world's political and business elite are gathering in the Swiss Alps this week amid deepening global uncertainty, and few appearances are being watched more closely than that of Trump, who is set to return to the WEF for the first time in 6 years

title: Mehbooba Mufti vs Farooq Abdullah Over "Dixon Plan" Controversy
content: A sharp political row has erupted between the National Conference (NC) and the People's Democratic Party (PDP) after NC President Farooq Abdullah criticised Mehbooba Mufti's demand for divisional status for the Pir Panjal and Chenab regions.

title: Russia Not Yet Invited To Proposed G7 Meeting In Paris: Kremlin
content: Russia has not yet received any invitation for a proposed G7 meeting in Paris, the Kremlin said Tuesday.

title: UK Unemployment Rate Near 5-Year High At 5.1%: Report
content: Britain's unemployment rate remained at 5.1 percent at the end of last year, official data showed Tuesday, as companies trimmed staff amid UK budget uncertainty.

title: Uttarakhand's Vanishing Winter: A Crisis In The Himalayas
content: Uttarakhand is grappling with an unprecedented climate crisis. November and December passed without a drop of rain or a flake of snow, and with more than half of January gone, there are still no signs of relief.

title: Elon Musk Polls X On Buying Ryanair After Spat With CEO
content: Elon Musk has once again grabbed global attention by taking a business dispute to social media, this time involving Europe's largest low-cost airline, Ryanair.

title: Swachh Survekshan 2026: MCC launches cleanliness category competitions
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: The AFC North: 1 coach, 2 (?) starting QBs, many questions
content: new coach will have to cultivate a working relationship with lamar Jackson . owner Steve Bisciotti learned that Mike Tomlin had stepped down as the Pittsburgh Steelers ' head coach . this has become one of the most surprising offseasons in the AFC North because of the uncharacteristic turnover .

title: DKS' brother namedrops Rahul in CM row; Sidda puts it to 'high command’
content: Speculation over the Karnataka chief minister post continues. DK Shivakumar's brother said that Rahul Gandhi assured a decision would be made  at an "appropriate time". Shivakumar is reportedly exercising restraint for party unity. The upcoming legislative session may offer clarity. Meanwhile, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah remains open to discussions in New Delhi.

title: 1st T20I: Not Iyer! India captain reveals Tilak's replacement in playing XI
content: India captain Suryakumar Yadav said Ishan Kishan will bat at No. 3 ahead of Shreyas Iyer in the New Zealand T20 series as he is part of India’s T20 World Cup squad and a like-for-like replacement for injured Tilak Varma. Iyer will be considered at No. 5. Suryakumar stressed flexibility in batting roles and prioritised team success over individual form.

title: FAFO to TACO: The terms that define Trump 2.0
content: Perhaps we should take the Kantian route and try to explain the world through terms. So here are some terms from the second Trump administration to try and decode what’s going on.

title: Joint venture: Sony cedes Bravia TV control to TCL; new entity to start in April 2027
content: Sony is partnering with Chinese rival TCL Electronics, ceding majority control of its iconic Bravia TV brand. In a new joint venture, Sony will hold a 49% stake, while TCL takes 51%, to manage global TV and home audio operations.

title: Delhi pollution: GRAP IV restrictions revoked; decision after slight improvement
content: Delhi-NCR's air quality has seen improvement, leading the Commission for Air Quality Management to revoke GRAP-IV restrictions just three days after their re-imposition. While the 'severe+' category triggered the ban, stages I, II, and III of GRAP remain active.  This move offers some relief from the stringent pollution control measures.

title: Not Gukesh or Erigaisi! After Carlsen, Indian GM confirmed for Norway Chess
content: Indian GM R Praggnanandhaa has confirmed his third appearance at Norway Chess, becoming the second announced participant after Magnus Carlsen. The 2026 Candidates qualifier and world No. 4 previously won the event in 2022 and defeated Carlsen in 2024. Organisers praised his consistency and ambition, while hopes remain for D Gukesh and Arjun Erigaisi to join the field.

title: What Musk, Altman, Brin agree on: Students should pay attention to computer science & maths
content: Elon Musk, Sam Altman and Sergey Brin are not selling students the newest AI tool or coding shortcut. Their advice is older, harder and suddenly urgent: go back to maths and core computer science. As AI makes routine coding and formula work cheap, what rises in value is judgment — the ability to reason, build systems, and spot when an answer is polished nonsense.

title: Sulaiman Khan Ghori exit: Engineer leaves xAI after podcast; sparks firing speculation
content: Former xAI engineer Sulaiman Khan Ghori has departed the company, sparking speculation he was "fired" for being "too candid" during a podcast interview. Ghori discussed xAI's rapid development, novel architectures like "Macro Hard," and innovative deployment strategies, including using Tesla computers for "human emulators."

title: Crash on 90-degree road: How civic neglect killed techie in 'planned' Noida
content: The heartbreaking drowning of a software engineer in an overflown, decade-old trench underscores a serious lapse in stormwater management over the years. Although funding and blueprints were set in 2015 to build a vital water-diverting regulator for the Hindon River, this life-saving project has yet to materialize, leading to devastating flooding that has affected numerous housing developments.

title: Tech phaseout proposal: EU plans to bar Chinese companies; industry warns of cost impact
content: The EU is reportedly planning to mandate the exclusion of Chinese firms like Huawei and ZTE from critical infrastructure, including telecom and solar energy. This move, mirroring US actions, aims to bolster security and reduce reliance on "high-risk" suppliers.

title: China criticises US tariffs at World Economic Forum; promises wider opening of economy
content: China used its platform at the World Economic Forum in Davos to warn that trade and tariff wars help no one and risk deepening global economic tensions. Vice-Premier He Lifeng called for cooperation over isolation, saying China would open its economy further and focus on boosting domestic demand, even as global trade disputes escalate under US President Donald Trump’s expanded tariff policies.

title: Warning! 'Ball daal apna chup chap aur peeche ja': Rohit Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav
content: Former captain Rohit Sharma offered advice to spinner Kuldeep Yadav for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Sharma suggested Yadav focus on his bowling and refrain from frequent appeals. This comes as the team considers selection between Yadav and Varun Chakaravarthy. Yadav is part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup.

title: Ranji Trophy: Rahul to play for Karnataka; NKR confirms availability for Andhra
content: KL Rahul will return to Ranji Trophy action for Karnataka against Punjab from January 29, while Nitish Kumar Reddy has confirmed availability for Andhra Pradesh’s remaining group games. Shubman Gill and Ravindra Jadeja are also set for domestic outings. Meanwhile, Rishabh Pant is likely to miss the second leg of the tournament due to injury and he may head to the CoE in coming days.

title: The new H-1B map: Where America pays global talent and where it quietly doesn’t
content: A year after Donald Trump’s return to office, the H-1B visa is no longer a uniform national pathway. Using US Department of Labor data analysed by Manifest Law, this story maps how sharply H-1B wages now diverge by city—turning geography into destiny, reshaping leverage for workers, and creating unequal outcomes, especially for Indian professionals navigating America’s talent economy.

title: 'I don't care about Nobel Prize': Trump breaks silence on letter to Norway PM
content: President Trump declared he no longer cares about the Nobel Prize after not receiving it, despite previously campaigning for it. He also stated he no longer feels obligated to "think purely of Peace" regarding Greenland, questioning Denmark's ownership and demanding NATO support for U.S. control of the territory.

title: Stock market crash: Nifty50 ends below 25,250; BSE Sensex down over 1,000 points - top reasons
content: Stock market crash today: Indian stock markets, Nifty50 and Sensex, experienced a significant crash today, driven by a sharp selloff in technology stocks amidst uneven earnings and global trade uncertainties. Foreign investors continued their selling spree, while gold and silver prices surged, signaling a clear shift towards risk aversion among investors seeking safe havens.

title: Noida techie death: Trucker rammed into same boundary wall 10 days ago; yet no repair
content: A 27-year-old software engineer tragically drowned after his SUV plunged into a deep, water-filled pit in Noida's Sector 150. The same damaged wall had been hit by a truck just days prior. Despite repeated warnings and a prior incident, no repairs were made, sparking outrage and administrative action.

title: India's trailblazer: From Sania mix-ups to sporting immortality - farewell Nehwal
content: Indian badminton icon Saina Nehwal has officially retired at 35, concluding a storied career marked by numerous firsts.  She became the first Indian woman to win an Olympic medal in badminton, achieve World No. 1 ranking, and reach the BWF World Championship final.  Her grit popularised the sport, inspiring a generation.

title: Horror in Australia: Fire outside stadium with Babar, Smith playing - Watch
content: A small fire outside Perth’s Optus Stadium caused brief panic during a BBL 2025–26 Qualifier between Perth Scorchers and Sydney Sixers. Thick smoke near a gate drew attention, but the match continued. Security acted swiftly, the fire was controlled, no injuries were reported, and fans were reassured by BBL officials.

title: 'Did he leave his hair in Montecito?': Prince Harry mocked over courtroom look- watch
content: Prince Harry's recent court visit in London sparked an intriguing online dialogue regarding his receding hairline, made all the more striking against a throwback image Meghan Markle posted showcasing him with a luscious head of hair.

title: T20 WC: Pakistan bowler to miss; PCB decides to go in different direction
content: Pakistan may drop fast bowler Haris Rauf from their ICC T20 World Cup 2026 plans, according to reports. Influenced by head coach Mike Hesson, the decision follows Rauf’s absence from recent T20 internationals since the 2025 Asia Cup, as selectors assess other bowling options despite his strong Big Bash League form.

title: ‘Expose them to public’: PM Modi targets parties ‘protecting’ illegal immigrants
content: Without naming any political party, but in an apparent attack on Trinamool Congress (TMC), which rules the poll-bound West Bengal, PM Modi lashed out at parties "covering up for illegal immigrants" and said: "We must expose them to the public". ​PM Modi also said the world doesn't question the "wealthiest and most powerful countries" when they crack down on illegal immigrants.

title: Kerala: Row over governor’s address in assembly — what happened
content: Kerala governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar omitted and added to the state cabinet-approved policy address, drawing sharp criticism from chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan. The chief minister urged the speaker to consider only the cabinet-approved version as the official record. A similar incident occurred in Tamil Nadu where the governor walked out after refusing to read the prepared address.

title: T20 World Cup row: 'We will not accept' - Bangladesh rejects ICC's 'unreasonable' conditions
content: Bangladesh has rejected "unreasonable conditions" from the ICC for the T20 World Cup 2026 in India, citing venue concerns and the exclusion of Mustafizur Rahman from the IPL. Despite talks, Bangladesh's participation remains uncertain as the ICC insists on the original schedule, assuring security.

title: Crowd chants 'Gambhir haye haye'; Virat Kohli reacts— watch
content: A viral video claiming Indore crowds chanted slogans against head coach Gautam Gambhir after the third ODI against New Zealand is misleading. Fact-checkers found the audio was likely from an older incident, not genuine chants from the stadium. The focus now shifts to the T20I series against New Zealand.

title: NEET PG cut off controversy explained: Here is what has happened so far
content: NEET PG 2025 qualifying cut-offs were drastically lowered, allowing candidates with zero or negative scores to be eligible for counselling. This move, aimed at filling vacant postgraduate seats, has sparked widespread criticism from medical bodies concerned about academic standards and patient safety. The controversy has escalated to the Supreme Court, highlighting broader issues of merit and governance in medical education.

title: Noida techie’s death: Builder arrested for criminal negligence
content: Greater Noida police arrested Abhay Kumar, builder of MZ Wiztown, in connection with the death of software engineer Yuvraj Mehta. Mehta's SUV plunged into an unbarricaded, water-filled pit on January 16-17. The arrest follows findings of negligence in construction site safety measures.

title: 8th Pay Commission: How much will your salary, pension increase?
content: Central government employees and pensioners await the 8th Pay Commission's recommendations on revised salaries and pensions. The commission, led by Ranjana Prakash Desai, will finalize a fitment factor, a multiplier crucial for determining salary hikes. Projections show significant increases based on potential fitment factors ranging from 2.15 to 2.86.

title: 'Want to play like him': Hardik Pandya's special message leaves RCB player emotional
content: Hardik Pandya sent a special video message to RCB's Gautami Naik after her match-winning fifty in the WPL. Naik, who considers Pandya her idol, was overjoyed by the gesture. Pandya congratulated her on her maiden half-century and urged her to stay disciplined and enjoy the game. RCB continued their winning streak, remaining unbeaten.

title: Maggi packets, 20kg rice, cylinders: JeM’s winter bunker unearthed; terrorists stocked up for months
content: A Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammad terror hideout, stocked for months, was busted by the army in Kishtwar's high mountains. The intense operation resulted in the supreme sacrifice of one commando and injuries to several others. Security forces continue to comb the area following the discovery.

title: 'A deal is a deal': EU chief pushes back as Trump threatens 100% tariffs over Greenland
content: EU chief Ursula von der Leyen warned the US against imposing tariffs on European allies over Greenland, calling it a "mistake" that could damage partnerships. She emphasized that existing trade deals must be honored and offered increased European investment and cooperation on Arctic security, urging Europe to adapt to global changes.

title: US-EU ties straining? How Trump's Greenland bid may benefit India
content: India stands to gain from the US-EU trade friction as the EU finalizes its Free Trade Agreement with New Delhi. With US tariffs impacting European exports, the bloc may accelerate ties with India. Experts suggest this could lead to a more favorable deal and faster ratification, potentially boosting Indian exports amid global trade uncertainties.

title: ‘Great stupidity’: After Greenland, Trump eyes Diego Garcia; why it matters to India
content: President Trump's criticism of the UK potentially returning Diego Garcia to Mauritius, a move backed by India, has escalated. This island hosts a vital US military base. India, with its own security interests in the Indian Ocean and historical ties to Mauritius, is supporting the decolonization process, offering significant aid for the archipelago's development.

title: Budget 2026: Why standard deduction should be hiked under the new income tax regime
content: Budget 2026 income tax expectations: Salaried taxpayers are looking at FM Nirmala Sitharaman to provide further relief under the new income tax regime, especially in the form of higher standard deduction limit.

title: No more A+ category? BCCI plans contract overhaul; Kohli, Rohit likely to drop
content: The BCCI is considering a major overhaul of its central contracts, potentially scrapping the Grade A+ category. This move could see senior players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, now focusing on ODIs, placed in Grade B. The proposed three-tier system aims to align contracts with workload and format involvement.

title: Cervical cancer can be silent in stage 1: Docs explain how
content: Cervical cancer is a silent threat, often lacking early symptoms, making awareness and regular screening crucial. Subtle signs like irregular bleeding or unusual discharge are frequently dismissed but warrant medical attention. Early detection, especially in Stage 1, offers highly treatable outcomes with excellent survival rates. Don't ignore subtle bodily changes; consult a doctor promptly.

title: AL West update: Will M's spend more? Will Astros make a deal?
content: the biggest contract handed out in the American League West occurred on Nov. 17, a mere two weeks into the offseason . it wasn't from the Houston Astros, who claimed seven division titles and two world Series championships from 2017 to 2024 . the Seattle Mariners authored one of their greatest seasons in 2025 .

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the top six teams remain the same . just two of the Huskies' 13 remaining regular-season opponents are ranked: Notre Dame and Tennessee .

title: Blue Monday: Why Marc Guéhi joining Man City leaves Liverpool in a mess
content: the third Monday of January has been widely dubbed "Blue Monday" for more than two decades . sceptics would argue the occasion is nothing more than a marketing ploy . liverpool fans will certainly have felt glum on Monday afternoon . click here for more transfer news .

title: Iowa women crack top 10 for 1st time post-Clark
content: the Huskies have won 34 consecutive games dating back to last season . the first-place votes in parentheses are no. 2 south Carolina and no. 3 UCLA . each team climbed one placard despite losing to south Carolina last week .

title: Which injuries will have the biggest impact on the Olympic hockey tournament?
content: leo Carlsson is out three to five weeks with a thigh injury . the 21-year-old has 38 points through 29 games this season . he has been struggling recently to the tune of six points in 15 games .

title: Can Kenneth Walker III carry Seahawks to Super Bowl after Zach Charbonnet's injury?
content: Seahawks running back Zach Charbonnet missed the rest of the playoffs with a knee injury . the seahawks might not be hosting the game at Lumen Field as the conference's top seed . a successful try tied the score at 30-30 .

title: Who's getting into the Hall of Fame? Everything you need to know on ballot reveal day
content: the 2026 ballot features 27 players worth a combined 1,282 WAR . the 2013 ballot featured 37 candidates . 10 players from that ballot have since been e-mailed to the class of 2026 . a year ago, I wrote of the 2025 candidates for the Hall of Fame .

title: Matt LaFleur's candidates to replace Packers DC Jeff Hafley could include Raheem Morris
content: the Packers wanted to re-sign Matt LeFleur . the Packers lost their defensive coordinator on monday . he will be reunited with former Packers vice president of player personnel . "we'll make sure we have a good plan in place," he says .

title: Sources: Warriors' Butler tears ACL, ending season
content: wing Jimmy Butler suffered a season-ending torn right ACL in a 135-112 win over the Miami Heat . he leaped to grab an entry pass in the middle of the paint and collided with Heat guard Davion Mitchell . his right knee appeared to twist on the landing, sending him sprawling to the court in agony .

title: 🤔 Big questions on Bills' coaching change
content: Sean McDermott's tenure as the Buffalo Bills ' head coach ended Monday . the bills had the second-most wins (98-50) of any franchise since 2017 . general manager Brandon Beane has been promoted to president of football operations .

title: Indiana -- yes, Indiana! -- is the national champ! How Curt Cignetti and the Hoosiers did it
content: a year ago, it felt hard to believe the losingest program in FBS history would have much staying power . critics ripped their schedule, called them a fluke, debated whether they even deserved to make the college football Playoff . they should leave the real football to the real blue bloods . the man simply does not lose .
